title: Alexander Skarsgard and his lush beard talks Nicole Kidman reunion
text:
Be still our beating hearts (Picture: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

This is not a drill – Big Little Lies and True Blood star Alexander Skarsgard has a full beard now and frankly, it’s a lot to handle.

During a Q&A as a part of Esquire’s Townhouse events on Saturday night, the Golden Globe-winner rocked the new look as he opened up about his former Big Little Lies co-star Nicole Kidman.

Turns out he’d be more than keen to team up with the Aussie actress once more.

On the subject of acting with her again, Skarsgard told Metro.co.uk and fans: ‘I love Nicole Kidman and she was a dream to work with.

‘I love her on and off-set, she’s a wonderful human being and extraordinary actress and I can’t imagine having a better partner when you’re doing something that intense and dark because … trust is so important for something that intense and that violent and that dark and we were able to find that before we started shooting.

‘I think that was instrumental. I would love to work with her again.’

In 2017, Skarsgard and Kidman appeared together as married couple Perry and Celeste in season one of Big Little Lies.

Nicole Kidman and Alexander Skarsgard won SAG awards for their performances in Big Little Lies (Picture: Dan MacMedan/Getty Images)

During the course of the series, they shared some disturbing and hard-hitting scenes together, as Perry repeatedly abused Celeste both physically and mentally.

Skarsgard previously spoke about what it was like filming with Kidman, telling Vanity Fair: ‘It was very important to reconnect after shooting those scenes.

‘We made a point of checking in with each other, giving each other a hug. Nicole is an incredible partner because she is so generous and so open and it makes it easier as an actor when you have a partner like that.’

Kidman and Skarsgard are said to be reuniting as cast members for Robert Eggers’ (The Witch, The Lighthouse) new film The Northman.

The movie has been described as a ‘Viking revenge saga set in Iceland at the turn of the 10th century’.

Sounds chill.

If you want to see more of Skarsgard and his brand new beard, you’ll be able to catch both of them in the upcoming TV adaptation of Stephen King’s The Stand.

Skarsgard will be playing Randal Flagg, a character who has appeared in several of King’s books as a power-hungry sorcerer.

The series, which is currently being filmed, is due to drop in 2020.

description: Alexander Skarsgard and his new beard had some very lovely things to say about his Big Little Lies costar Nicole Kidman.
